Color fonts

Colored fonts are fonts that can have build-in color information in their glyphs. It is very useful when you want to display symbols whose color could be well defined by the character combination, such as chemical elements.

Cascadia Mono + Jmol color scheme, Light theme

Cascadia Mono + Jmol color scheme, Dark theme

Cascadia Mono + Rasmol Amino Prot color scheme + fasta support

Cascadia Mono + Nucleotide color scheme + fasta support

Scriptified Fonts

Simple TeX style super/subscript can be implemented by via ligature.

Cascadia Mono + Script

Type a^2 + b^2 = c^2 and Ba^{2+} + SO_4^{2-} = BaSO_4 in the following input box:

Liberation Serif + Chemical Script

A simplified syntax for chemical formulas is used to drop the need for curly braces.
